column1: Mulki is a panchayat town located at Mangalore taluk in Dakshina Kannada district in the Indian state of Karnataka.  It is on the banks of Shambhavi River. It was earlier known as Moolikapur
column2: turned to Mulki. A small town with people of diverse religions
column3: it is 10 km north of Suratkal.  Karnad is a locality within Mulki. Nearest railway station is Mulki railway station
398. Males constitute 48% of the population and females 52%. Mulki has an average literacy rate of 77%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 82%
column5: and female literacy is 73%. In Mulki
column6: 11% of the population is under 6 years of age.

column1: The majority population of Mulki is Hindu
column2: although there is a significant diversity in the form of Muslim and Christians. Hindus in Mulki are very diverse in themselves with a significant population of Billavas

column1: Skilled workers form small cottage industries and are entrepreneurial. Other major contribution to the local economy comes from agriculture and fishing.
